intro: Pithecoctenium scabriusculum, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and edible leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are rough to the touch and have a distinctive grayish-green color, while its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or reddish. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
